meanings.definition: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The cacophony of car horns outside the window was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The cacophony of the busy city street filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The cacophony of barking dogs and meowing cats made the neighborhood sound like a zoo.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the cacophony of voices, she struggled to hear her own thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The cacophony of pots and pans clattering in the kitchen was a symphony of chaos.

meanings.sent1: The cacophony of laughter and music at the party was infectious.
meanings.sent2: The cacophony of the playground echoed through the park.
meanings.sent3: The cacophony of chirping birds and rustling leaves created a peaceful chaos in the forest.
meanings.sent4: In the cacophony of the storm, the thunder roared like a lion.
meanings.sent5: The cacophony of children playing in the yard was a joyful symphony of noise.
